channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two different speed signs, 15th May
item.description:
Turning into Mill Lane form Shurdington Road, one side of the road says its 40mph and the other side says its 30mph, I belive the sign has been damaged and turned the wrong way, however its confusing on which speed is correct
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Mill Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pittville Crescent Lane Wallkway unsafe, 14th May
item.description:
I am 79 years old and in a wheelchair. I can no longer use pavement along Pittville Crescent Lane safety and have twice now twysted badly when wheels caught on old broken pavers. Yesterday i fell against a side wall due to this problem. Apart from staying on road, wheelchairs can't use the walkway to travel safely any longer. This pavement needs to be fully retarded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole appeared after rain. Deep but relatively small in diameter, 14th May
item.description:
The pothole is near the kerd if you are travelling down Helwett Road towards A435. Almost outside the Berkeley Garage
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Hewlett Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham

item.title: Bridge slats broken through, 14th May
item.description:
Two slats of the bridge are broken completely through and are a trip hazard. Particularly dangerous for dogs, small children or people using walking aids.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gevum Way, Gloucester

item.title: Pittville Park Toilets revolting, 14th May
item.description:
Pitville Park toilets are old and smelly For a public Park as frequently used by 1000s of visitors each week, it's really a poor show and not pleasant to use them. They need total revamp and daily cleaning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: About 8 ash trees with die back , on highways verge most on private land, 14th May
item.description:
All along Timbercombe lane . Gl538EE. Owner or son of owner is Richard Thomas 07939 208042. Raised the issue in Dec 2023. He seemed dismissive of the problem which is clearly apparent this spring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Timbercombe Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on private land

item.title: Large hole in the pavement, large enough for someone to put a foot into. this is over a previous repair from about 10 years ago, 14th May
item.description:
Outside 7 Sidney Street, GL52 6DJ on the pavement. this has been present for a while, but in recent weeks it has got significantly deeper and opened up a lot. this is being reported as i am concerned about animals/children putting their foot in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Sidney Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
